Package edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller

Class SkiResortController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller.SkiResortController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/ski-resorts")
@ExposesResourceFor(SkiResort.class)
public class SkiResortController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST Controller class for SkiResort to receive parameter values taken from HTTP requests to their respective specified URL endpoints, and returning serialized JSON object results to HTTP responses.

        @GetMapping(value="/location",
            produces="application/json")
public SkiResort getByLatitudeAndLongitude​(@RequestBody
                                           double latitude,
                                           @RequestBody
                                           double longitude,
                                           org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)

        longitude - Longitude of ski resort.

      • setFavorite

        @PutMapping(value="/{skiResortId:[0-9a-fA-F\\-]{32,36}}/favorite",
            produces={"application/json","text/plain"},
            consumes={"application/json","text/plain"})
public boolean setFavorite​(@PathVariable
                           java.util.UUID skiResortId,
                           @RequestBody
                           boolean favorite,
                           org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Sets a ski resort to a user's favorites; otherwise, throws a NoSuchElementException if not found.
        Parameters:
        skiResortId - ID of ski resort
        favorite - True if the ski resort is part of the user's favorites.
        auth - Security authentication
        Returns:
        True if the ski resort is part of the user's favorites.

      • post

        @PostMapping(produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
@ResponseStatus(CREATED)
public SkiResort post​(@RequestBody
                      SkiResort skiResort,
                      org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Saves a ski resort to the database.
        Parameters:
        skiResort - Ski resort to be saved.
        auth - Security authentication.
        Returns:
        A ski resort saved to the database.

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping("/{skiResortId}")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void delete​(@PathVariable
                   java.util.UUID skiResortId,
                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Delete a ski resort from the database according to it's ID if one exists.
        Parameters:
        skiResortId - ID of specified ski resort.
        auth - Security authentication.
